DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the acute effects of oxygen supplementation during a submaximal exercise test in patients with Eisenmenger's Syndrome.
DOC.brief_title: Effects Oxygen Supplementation Determined Better Exercise Capacity in Eisenmenger Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with Eisenmenger's syndrome were submitted to a submaximal exercise test (six-minute walking test) with and without supplemental oxygen. The distance walked during the two tests were compared to assess the impact of oxygen supplementation on the walking distance.
DOC.criteria: Abscence of heart failure and/or respiratory infection Advanced therapy for pulmonary hypertension Lung, liver or connective tissue diseases Neuromuscular diseases Inability to perform a pulmonary function test and/or chronic lung disease Inability to walk
